Posts.Content: Diagnosed in 2007, PSA6.6, Gleason 8, External beam therapie: Jan-March 2008, PSA Nadir 0.01 until May 2014 when the PSA started rising, PSA=0.60; January 2015 PSA=1.23; June 2015 PSA=1.46; biculatamide 50mg daily; July 2015 PSA 0.20; biculatamide 50mg every second day; Nov 2016 PSA 0.39 biculatamide 50mg/daily; January 2017 PSA=0.14; CT PET choline scan=negative; 14 February 2017 stopped biculatamide; 27 Feb PSA=0.33, high velocity! Q1:Shall I wait until PSA=2.01? Q2: Shall I restart biculatamide 50mg/daily now? Q3: Shall I do PSMA PET CT study now? Q4: Any other suggestions Thank you and Regards
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer relapse

Posts.Content: Thank you and in particular for the link to "Auximum PET Scan"
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer relapse
